name: EnchantmentHelper
description: The EnchantmentHelper class provides a comprehensive interface for working with Minecraft enchantments in JSMacros scripts.
overview: It allows you to access enchantment properties, check compatibility, generate formatted names, and interact with the enchantment system. This class is essential for any script that needs to work with enchanted items, enchantment tables, or custom enchantment logic.

constructors.description: Creates an EnchantmentHelper instance from an enchantment ID. The `minecraft:` namespace is optional.
Creates an EnchantmentHelper instance from an enchantment ID and a specific level. This level will be returned by getLevel().

methods.name: getLevel
methods.description: Gets the level value stored in this EnchantmentHelper instance. Note that this may be 0 if the helper was created without specifying a level.
examples:
const sharpness = new EnchantmentHelper("minecraft:sharpness", 3);
Chat.log(`Level: ${sharpness.getLevel()}`); // Output: Level: 3

methods.name: getMinLevel
methods.description: Gets the lowest level that this enchantment can have in normal gameplay.
examples:
const sharpness = new EnchantmentHelper("minecraft:sharpness");
Chat.log(`Min level: ${sharpness.getMinLevel()}`); // Output: Min level: 1

methods.name: getMaxLevel
methods.description: Gets the highest level that this enchantment can have in normal gameplay.
examples:
const sharpness = new EnchantmentHelper("minecraft:sharpness");
Chat.log(`Max level: ${sharpness.getMaxLevel()}`); // Output: Max level: 5

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Gets the localized name of the enchantment in the current language.
examples:
const sharpness = new EnchantmentHelper("minecraft:sharpness");
Chat.log(`Name: ${sharpness.getName()}`); // Output: Name: Sharpness

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Gets the unique identifier for this enchantment.
examples:
const sharpness = new EnchantmentHelper("minecraft:sharpness");
Chat.log(`ID: ${sharpness.getId()}`); // Output: ID: minecraft:sharpness

methods.name: getWeight
methods.description: Gets the weight value that determines how likely this enchantment is to be selected in enchanting tables and loot tables. Higher values mean more common.

methods.name: isCursed
methods.description: Curses are special enchantments that cannot be removed from items and typically cannot be obtained through enchanting tables.

methods.name: isTreasure
methods.description: Treasure enchantments cannot be obtained through enchanting tables but can be found in loot chests, fishing, or villager trading.

methods.name: getLevelName
methods.description: Gets the formatted name for a specific level of this enchantment.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The level to generate a name for

examples:
const sharpness = new EnchantmentHelper("minecraft:sharpness");
Chat.log(sharpness.getLevelName(1)); // Output: Sharpness I
Chat.log(sharpness.getLevelName(3)); // Output: Sharpness III
Chat.log(sharpness.getLevelName(5)); // Output: Sharpness V

methods.name: getRomanLevelName
methods.description: Gets the enchantment name with the level displayed as a Roman numeral. Uses the instance's current level.
examples:
const sharpness = new EnchantmentHelper("minecraft:sharpness", 3);
Chat.log(sharpness.getRomanLevelName().getString()); // Output: Sharpness III

methods.name: getRomanLevelName
methods.description: Gets the enchantment name with the level displayed as a Roman numeral. Automatically uses Arabic numerals for levels outside the range 1-3999.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The level to generate a name for

methods.name: isCompatible
methods.description: Checks if this enchantment can be combined with the specified enchantment.

parameters.name: enchantment
parameters.description: The enchantment to check compatibility with

methods.name: conflictsWith
methods.description: The opposite of isCompatible(). Returns true if the enchantments cannot be combined.

parameters.name: enchantment
parameters.description: The enchantment to check for conflicts

methods.name: getCompatibleEnchantments
methods.description: Gets a list of all enchantments that can be combined with this one. Only considers enchantments that can be applied to the same item types.

methods.name: getCompatibleEnchantments
methods.description: Gets compatible enchantments, optionally ignoring item type restrictions.

parameters.name: ignoreType
parameters.description: Whether to ignore item type restrictions

methods.name: getConflictingEnchantments
methods.description: Gets a list of all enchantments that conflict with this one. Only considers enchantments that apply to the same item types.

methods.name: getConflictingEnchantments
methods.description: Gets conflicting enchantments, optionally ignoring item type restrictions.

parameters.name: ignoreType
parameters.description: Whether to ignore item type restrictions

methods.name: canBeApplied
methods.description: Checks if this enchantment is valid for the specified item type and doesn't conflict with existing enchantments.

methods.name: getAcceptableItems
methods.description: Gets a list of all item types that this enchantment can be applied to.
